Authors:
Rémy Poncet, Jean Hivert, Christian Fontaine, Frédéric
Picot, Seraphin Lampion, Ehoarn Bidault
Title:
First record of the saprotrophic fungi Hexagonia hydnoides
(Sw.) M. Fidalgo (Polyporaceae) from Europa (Scattered Islands, Indian
Ocean, French Southern and Antarctic Lands) and attempt to understand
its global distribution
Keywords:
Hexagonia hydnoides, Polyporaceae, Species Distribution
Model, Molecular Clock, Ecological Distance Computation
Abstract:
Hexagonia hydnoides is a well-known basidiomycete, which
distribution is widely documented by numerous occurrence records in the
Neotropic and American subtropical area, but is sparsely recorded in
Africa from where only a few data are currently available in literature
and databases. A first record of this species is reported from Europa
Island, an uninhabited territory located in Mozambique Channel.
Worldwide distribution of H. hydnoides is modeled thanks to ensemble
modelling of Random Forest and MaxEnt algorithms and a focus is done in
the Indian Ocean, South Asia and North of Australia areas regarding its
potential presence in regards with the distribution of its known host
tree species.
